result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:48 PM Defendant Emmanuel L Maddox in court, in custody.  Attorney Dominic Richards in court for Emmanuel L Maddox.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #   1, 2, 3, 4.

Casee T
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defn requests plea/sentencing
Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Prior: 407 Pawling St, Madison, WI 53704 United States
and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant may use third party once a week for child visitation/exchanges.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KJR. 
- Defendant shall not be on Rethke Ave in Madison. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
